professionals.name: Edgar Allan Poe
professionals.description: The master of macabre and melancholic poetry, known for works like 'The Raven' and 'Annabel Lee.'

professionals.name: Emily Dickinson
professionals.description: A reclusive genius known for her profound and unconventional poetry exploring themes of death, immortality, and nature.

professionals.name: Sylvia Plath
professionals.description: Renowned for her deeply confessional poetry that examines themes of identity, depression, and resilience.

professionals.name: T.S. Eliot
professionals.description: A modernist poet whose works like 'The Waste Land' reshaped English poetry with rich symbolism and themes of alienation.

professionals.name: Walt Whitman
professionals.description: A pioneer of free verse, celebrated for his groundbreaking work 'Leaves of Grass.'

professionals.name: John Keats
professionals.description: A Romantic poet known for his odes and the vivid imagery of his meditations on beauty and mortality.

hobbyists.name: John Doe
hobbyists.description: Exploring themes of solitude and wonder through accessible language and heartfelt imagery.

hobbyists.name: Jane Doe
hobbyists.description: A new poet experimenting with themes of love and modern existentialism through short forms.

hobbyists.name: Sally Doe
hobbyists.description: Crafting vivid stories with a focus on themes of family, nostalgia, and hope.

hobbyists.name: Jack Doe
hobbyists.description: Blending humor and poignancy in verses that reflect on everyday life and personal growth.
